questions.question_text:
You want to create a file watcher and an event-based job for detecting the arrival of files on the local server from various locations. To achieve this, you enable the raising of file arrival events from remote systems.
Which two conditions must be satisfied to receive file arrival events from a remote system? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Answer: CD

To receive file arrival events from a remote system, you must install the Scheduler agent on that system, and you must register the agent with the database. The remote system does not require a running Oracle Database instance to generate file arrival events.

https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/scheduse005.htm
CD Confirmed

Selected Answer: CD
To receive file arrival events from a remote system, you must install the Scheduler agent on that system, and you must register the agent with the database. 
The remote system does not require a running Oracle Database instance to generate file arrival events.

To enable the raising of file arrival events at remote systems: 
1.Set up the local database to run remote external jobs.
2.Install, configure, register, and start the Scheduler agent on the first remote system.
3.Repeat the previous step for each additional remote system.

A y D:
A file watcher can watch for a file on the local system (the same host computer running Oracle Database) or a remote system. Remote systems must be running the Scheduler agent, and the agent must be registered with the database.
References:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/scheduse005.htm
CD Confirmed
A,C Agree

choices.C: The local database must be set up to run remote external jobs.
choices.A: The remote system must have a running Oracle Database instance and a scheduler agent installed.
choices.D: The remote system's scheduler agent must be registered with your database.
choices.E: Database links to remote databases must be created.
choices.B: The initialization parameter REMOTE_OS_AUTHENT must be set to TRUE on your database.

choices.D: It fails because the command does not specify when the unified audit policy should be enforced.
choices.A: It succeeds and needs to be enabled to capture all SQL statements that require either the specified privileges or any privilege granted to the HR_ADMIN and role. OE_ADMIN
choices.C: It succeeds and starts capturing only successful SQL statements for all users who have either the specified privileges or roles granted to them.
choices.B: It fails because system privileges cannot be granted with roles in the same audit policy.

discussion.content:
Answer: A

After you create the policy, you must enable it by using the AUDIT statement.

The audit trail will capture SQL statements that require the CREATE ANY TABLE system privilege or the DROP ANY TABLE system privilege or any system privilege directly granted to the role.

https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/DBSEG/audit_config.htm#DBSEG357
Answer: A

The correct answer should be A because after creating the unified audit policy, you will need to enable it with the AUDIT POLICY statement and apply the unified audit policies to users.
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/DBSEG/audit_config.htm#DBSEG460

I think C is correct.
This plus the two below all say C. SO 3 sources agree.
http://itexam.io/exam/engine?exam=1z0-062
https://vceguide.com/which-statement-is-true-353/

questions.question_text:
Unified auditing is enabled in your database. The HR_ADMIN and OE_ADMIN roles exist and are granted system privileges.
You execute the command:
SQL>CREATE AUDIT POLICY tab1e_aud PRIVILEGES CREATE ANY TABLE, DROP ANY TABLE ROLES hr_admin, oe_admin;
Which statement is true?
Identify three uses of the CROSSCHECK command (Choose three.)

choices.B: to synchronize logical backup records with physical files in backup storage
choices.E: to update the recovery catalog or control file if archived log files are deleted with operating system commands
choices.D: to update information about backups that are deleted, corrupted, or inaccessible in a recovery catalog or control file
choices.C: to check the obsolete backups that can be deleted from the file system

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
"To ensure that data about backups in the recovery catalog or control file is synchronized with corresponding data on disk or in the media management catalog, perform a crosscheck. "
"Crosschecks update outdated RMAN repository information about backups whose repository records do not match their physical status. For example, if a user removes archived logs from disk with an operating system command, the repository still indicates that the logs are on disk, when in fact they are not."

Option D is right apart from the fact that RMAN does not check for validity of Tape backups, so corruption in Tape backups are not picked by RMAN.

https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/ADMQS/GUID-F9FC18D6-6FCA-4C6D-9B34-250470469495.htm#ADMQS0953

Selected Answer: ADE
Noted:
Use the CROSSCHECK command to synchronize the "physical reality of backups" and copies with their logical records in the RMAN repository.

But B ,is to synchronize the logical with physical. B is not correct

Selected Answer: ABD
Per Oracle Documentation for 12.1

A: "CROSSCHECK validates all specified backups and copies, even if they were created in previous database incarnations."
B: "synchronize the physical reality of backups and copies with their logical records in the RMAN repository."
D: "If a backup is on disk, then CROSSCHECK determines whether the header of the file is valid. If a backup is on tape, then RMAN queries the RMAN repository for the names and locations of the backup pieces to be checked. RMAN sends this metadata to the target database server, which queries the media management software about the backups. The media management software then checks its media catalog and reports back to the server with the status of the backups."

Selected Answer: BDE
Purpose

Use the CROSSCHECK command to synchronize the physical reality of backups and copies with their logical records in the RMAN repository.

I think A,B,D
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/RCMRF/rcmsynta014.htm#RCMRF119
Answer: C
Answer: C

Selected Answer: C
All Oracle software installation owners on a server are granted the OINSTALL privileges to read and write to Oracle Inventory Directory.
Ensure that the group designated as the OINSTALL group is available as a primary group for all planned Oracle software installation owners.
If you are installing Oracle software for the first time, then OUI creates an Oracle base and central inventory, and creates an Oracle inventory using information in the following priority:
-In the path indicated in the ORACLE_BASE environment variable set for the installation owner user account
-In an Optimal Flexible Architecture (OFA) path (u[01–99]/app/owner where owner is the name of the user account running the installation), and that user account has permissions to write to that path
-In the user home directory, in the path /app/owner, where owner is the name of the user account running the installation

Selected Answer: C
B incorrecta. Se crearía un nivel más arriba, es decir /u01/app/oraInventory
 D incorrecta: Ensure that the group designated as the OINSTALL group is available as a primary group for all planned Oracle software installation owners.
C, https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/12.2/axdbi/about-the-oracle-inventory-directory-and-installation.html#GUID-22CB62EF-D5DA-47BF-B4C3-C5D03B059728
Agree C

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about the Oracle central inventory directory (oraInventory)?

choices.D: Oracle software owners must be members of the same central oraInventory group, but they need not have this group as their primary group.
choices.C: lf an OFA-compliant path is not created and the ORACLE_BASE environment variable is not set during an Oracle Database installation, the Oracle Inventory directory is placed in the home directory of the user that is performing the installation.
choices.A: oraInventory must not be shared by all Oracle software installations on a single system.
choices.B: If ORACLE_BASE is set to /u01/app/oracle for the oracle user during an installation, OUI creates the Oracle Inventory directory in the /u01/app/oracle/ oraInventory

choices.D: The manageability monitor (MMON) process gathers statistics and creates an AWR snapshot that is used by the self-tuning components in a database.
choices.A: An AWR snapshot shows the SQL statements that are producing the highest load on the system, based on criteria such as elapsed time and CPU time.
choices.B: AWR data is stored in memory and in a database.
choices.E: An AWR snapshot contains system-wide tracing and logging information.
choices.C: All AWR tables belong to the SYSTEM schema.

comments.content:
SYSAUX is not the default SYSTEM schema tablespace, it's SYSTEM.
The Automatic Workload Repository (AWR) collects, processes, and maintains performance statistics for problem detection and self-tuning purposes. This data is both in memory and stored in the database. 
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e41573/autostat.htm#PFGRF02601

Thus the answer should be A,D,E as:
* AWR tables belong to SYS users and are stored in SYSAUX tablespace
* AWR does not use any space in the SGA --> it's not stored in memory

discussion.content:
The largest portion of the SYSAUX tablespace is occupied by the Automatic Workload Repository (AWR)
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28310/tspaces010.htm#ADMIN11387
A is not completely correct as AWR not just has SQL commands, it's only a section of the report. It has entire system level stats, including OS stats.

C. All AWR tables belong to the SYSTEM schema. I am unsure of this. SYSAUX is a auxiallry TS created for SYSTEM schema but all objects on SYSAUX need not be owned by SYSTEM as SYSAUX can be alloted to any other schema. SYSTEM schema owns the SYSTEM TS.

Since AWR data lies in SYSAUX TS, I'm confused if C is correct.

Selected Answer: BCD
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e41573/autostat.htm#PFGRF02601

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Automatic Workload Repository (AWR)? (Choose three.)
